title: Analyzing Learning Design from a Human Resource Development (HRD) Perspective in Democratic Kampuchea

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Reinterpreting historical cases from an HRD (Human Resource Development) perspective, analyzing the connection between forced labor and learning design through mathematical modeling.

learning_goals: Learners can explain structural features of learning designs by applying historical cases to HRD frameworks.
Learners can simulate educational policies of the Democratic Kampuchea era using mathematical models (system dynamics).
Learners can analyze and evaluate the impact of compulsory learning in group learning environments through VR-based scenarios.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
